citeinfo.origin: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), Biological Resources Division, Alaska Science Center (ASC)
citeinfo.title: Bering and Chukchi Sea Ecosystem Database

descript.abstract: The database is useful for analyzing the location and movement of animals relative to certain environmental characteristics. It supports research at the Alaska Science Center on Pacific walrus and other species endemic to the Bering/Chukchi region. The database report viewable here describes the bathymetry and benthic invertebrate portions of the database. These databases are bounded by the western Alaska coast to Point Barrow ( 155 W longitude) and the east Russian coast to Wrangel Island (182 E longitude), Aleutian Islands in the South (51 N latitude) and approximately 75 degrees latitude to the North.
descript.purpose: This database was created to provide geospatial data on physical and biological characteristics of the Bering/Chukchi Ecosystem.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
